parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To pass by, depart, pass away. From para and ago; to lead near, i.e. to go along or away.
Gen: from; dat: beside, in the presence of; acc: alongside of.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Probably prolonged from hals; the sea.
Of Hebrew origin; Galiloea, a region of Palestine.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: Properly, to stare at, i.e. to discern clearly; by extension, to attend to; by Hebraism, to experience; passively, to appear.
Simon. Of Hebrew origin; Simon, the name of nine Israelites.
Simon. Of Hebrew origin; Simon, the name of nine Israelites.
A brother, member of the same religious community, especially a fellow-Christian. A brother near or remote.
From aner; manly; Andreas, an Israelite.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Accusative Masculine Plural
str2: (a) I cast, throw, rush, (b) often, in the weaker sense: I place, put, drop. A primary verb; to throw.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Probably prolonged from hals; the sea.
For. A primary particle; properly, assigning a reason.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
A fisherman. From hals; a sailor, i.e. a fisher.
